{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3575693,"name":"Bradley Chumanov","username":"NukeMinecart","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nukeminecart/{size}/238978_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T00:39:15.547Z","cooked":"

Our issue

Our new Pigeon 2 is off by a significant amount over a set number of rotations. (100 - 170 degrees over 25 rotations at max speed, which amounts to 5 degrees per rotation). CTRE advertises a drift of less than a tenth of a degree per minute when moving.

Things we tried

We have already tried calibrating the Pigeon 2 with the Tuner X calibration, and enabling the compass. Neither have any significant impact on what the gyro reports.

We have looked at other teams and they seem to have no issue with placing their gyro offset from the center.

We do not handle initialization of the gyro. YAGSL does this.
Our code

Are there any solutions to this problem?

As far as I know, the Tuner X Calibration should have taken care of this, but it’s still worth it to ask.
Is the Pigeon flat on the robot (with regards to pitch and roll)? If it isn’t, that might lead to some inaccuracy (maybe, not an expert ).

Good luck!

Our pigeon is mounted parallel with the floor, attached to our belly pan with dual lock. There is no pitch or roll in the Pigeon

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-04-01T01:18:10.089Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497603,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-off-by-significant-amount-with-the-gyro-offset-from-center","display_username":"Bradley Chumanov","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64852,"username":"Mehmet1","name":"9016 captain/head prgm/driver","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mehmet1/{size}/238645_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69694,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1306 Co-President"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-off-by-significant-amount-with-the-gyro-offset-from-center/497603/3","reactions":[{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3575778,"name":"9016 captain/head prgm/driver","username":"Mehmet1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mehmet1/{size}/238645_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-01T01:46:52.242Z","cooked":"

I see in SwerveSubsystem.java, you have a replaceYAGSLIMU() method that seems to replace the pigeon with the the Limelight 4’s IMU. I see you never call it (it’s commented out), but I would make sure that it’s not being called by deploying the code and trying again.

With my limited expertise, I cannot find anything else that would be causing the problem. Perhaps re-flashing the Pigeon with the latest firmware could help?

One (admittedly jank) solution is that I notice you only use Megatag 2 measurements from your Limelights. I would suggest trying to use Megatag 1 as well (in the same way you use MT2) because it would return headings that are accurate in the long run as well. This would be a constant force that would “nudge” and correct the heading of the pose estimator.

The hesitation I have with this is your code doesn’t have dynamic/robust vision filtering, so even though this would correct the pose heading, it may be a bit erratic and unpredictable (especially at longer distances to tags) and you wouldn’t have any way to reject such bad measurements. Just a thought!

NukeMinecart:

attached to our belly pan with dual lock

Dual lock isn’t a rigid mount and could cause additional error to accumulate.

Go into Tuner X and find the Pigeon. In the plot window, select nomotioncount from the right and start plot at the top. If the plotted value remains zero, the Pigeon hasnt calibrated itself. It likes to calibrate automatically when it has almost no motion to it unless this setting is turned off. If it hasn’t calibrated, check the nomotiondisable setting and ensure it is off. Also, if there is vibration from the robot that wouldn’t allow it to sit perfectly still, try removing the vibration as much as possible. Hope this helps!
